text: Which of the following is a non-ionic detergent? (MHT CET 2022)
answer: Non-ionic detergents do not contain any ionic functional groups in their head. They are formed from the reaction of stearic acid with polyethylene glycol. **Polyethylene glycol stearate** is an example of a non-ionic detergent.

text: Which of the following is a broad-spectrum antibiotic? (MHT CET 2021)
answer: Broad-spectrum antibiotics are effective against a wide range of gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria. **Chloramphenicol** is a well-known example of a broad-spectrum antibiotic.

text: The chemical used to prevent food from spoilage is: (MHT CET 2020)
answer: **Food preservatives** are chemicals added to food products to prevent their spoilage due to microbial growth or undesirable chemical changes.

text: Which of the following is an artificial sweetening agent? (MHT CET 2019)
answer: **Aspartame** is an artificial sweetener that is approximately 200 times sweeter than sucrose. The other options are natural sugars.

text: Which of the following is a narcotic analgesic? (MHT CET 2018)
answer: Analgesics are drugs used to relieve pain. **Morphine** is a potent narcotic analgesic that is addictive and used for severe pain relief.

text: The principle of green chemistry is: (MHT CET 2017)
answer: **Waste prevention** is a core principle of green chemistry. The goal is to design chemical processes that minimize or eliminate the generation of hazardous substances, including waste.

text: Which of the following is an antiseptic? (MHT CET 2016)
answer: An antiseptic is a substance that prevents the growth of disease-causing microorganisms. **Chloroxylenol** is the main ingredient in Dettol, **Bithional** is added to soaps to reduce body odor, and **Iodoform** is a well-known antiseptic. Therefore, all the given options are correct.

text: The compound used as a tranquilizer is: (MHT CET 2015)
answer: Tranquilizers are a class of drugs that are used to treat mental illness and to relieve stress and anxiety. **Equanil** is an example of a tranquilizer.

text: Saccharin is an artificial sweetening agent that is approximately how many times sweeter than sucrose? (MHT CET 2014)
answer: **Saccharin** is a very potent artificial sweetener. It is approximately **550 times** sweeter than sucrose.

text: Which of the following is an example of a disinfectant? (MHT CET 2013)
answer: Disinfectants are chemicals that destroy microorganisms on inanimate objects. A **1% solution of phenol** is a known disinfectant, while a 0.2% solution of phenol acts as an antiseptic. Dettol and Savlon are antiseptics.

text: The drug used to reduce fever is called: (MHT CET 2012)
answer: Drugs used to lower body temperature and reduce fever are called **antipyretics**. Examples include aspirin and paracetamol.

text: Which of the following is a narrow-spectrum antibiotic? (MHT CET 2011)
answer: Narrow-spectrum antibiotics are effective against a specific type of bacteria. **Penicillin** is primarily effective against gram-positive bacteria, making it a narrow-spectrum antibiotic.

text: The compound used as a food preservative is: (MHT CET 2010)
answer: **Sodium benzoate** is a common food preservative used in acidic foods to prevent the growth of bacteria, yeasts, and molds.

text: Which of the following is a cationic detergent? (MHT CET 2009)
answer: Cationic detergents have a positively charged head group. **Cetyl trimethylammonium bromide** is a well-known example of a cationic detergent.

text: Which of the following is an antacid? (MHT CET 2008)
answer: **Antacids** are substances that neutralize stomach acid and are used to treat heartburn. **Cimetidine**, **Ranitidine**, and **Omeprazole** are all examples of antacids.
